headline: CNN Live Event/Special
subHeadline: Houston's Thanksgiving Day Parade; Macy's Thanksgiving Day Parade; A Sense of Home Changes Lives; Erin French Shares a Holiday Dish. Aired 9:30-10a ET

utterances.speaker: ERICA HILL, CNN ANCHOR
utterances.sentences: Look at that, Brainy Smurf.

utterances.speaker: JOHN BERMAN, CNN ANCHOR
utterances.sentences: That's Brainy Smurf.Welcome back to CNN's "Thanksgiving in America." Brainy Smurf making his way through Philadelphia.

utterances.speaker: HILL
utterances.sentences: Right, Brainy Smurf was actually Papa Smurf's apprentice. Did you know that?

utterances.speaker: BERMAN
utterances.sentences: I didn't know that.

utterances.speaker: HILL
utterances.sentences: I just learned that.

utterances.speaker: BERMAN
utterances.sentences: Does that - I mean I didn't think Papa Smurf played favorites. I think he really taught all the Smurfs how to grow.

utterances.speaker: HILL
utterances.sentences: You may be right. You may be right.Hey, how about this, Spider-man debuting in the parade. The new Spidey. Very exciting. First Spidey, of course, I think was back in - was that '87, '97? But here he is. This is - I heard people saying, I see Spider-man. I see Spider-man. People behind us. We've been waiting for this moment.

utterances.speaker: BERMAN
utterances.sentences: Yes. Spider-man going down Central Park West. He passed us just a second ago. And I have to say, the guy looked jacked. I mean, Spider-man does not skip a leg day. Look at that. Look at the definition there.

utterances.speaker: HILL
utterances.sentences: True.

utterances.speaker: BERMAN
utterances.sentences: He does -

utterances.speaker: HILL
utterances.sentences: Let that be your inspiration.

utterances.speaker: BERMAN
utterances.sentences: He does squats like every day. Balloon squats every day.

utterances.speaker: BERMAN
utterances.sentences: That is good information right there. We did not hear the twhip as it went by -

utterances.speaker: HILL
utterances.sentences: No.

utterances.speaker: BERMAN
utterances.sentences: Because the music and the joy, just so loud.

utterances.speaker: HILL
utterances.sentences: It's true. It's true. It overshadowed it.We are moments away from Houston's big Thanksgiving Day Parade getting underway. And that is where we find our good friend, Rosa Flores. Rosa, Olympic great Carl Lewis is the grand marshal. But I would say next year I think your pick - you're my pick. You look fabulous.

utterances.speaker: ROSA FLORES, CNN CORRESPONDENT
utterances.sentences: Welcome to the Huston Thanksgiving Day Parade, where everything is bigger in Houston. Let me tell you, you can look around. There's already a lot of people here lining the streets. About 20 blocks. And you can see that they're already waving goodbye.But, Erica and John, I have a task for you because I want you to get up and I want you to do the turkey dance with me because I can show you. I can guide you. Don't worry. Don't be nervous. We can do this together. If you're at home, you can do this too. All you need to do is you need to spread your wings. And then go round and round. Anybody up here willing to do it with me? You spread your wings. She's going to do it with me. There you go. You spread your wings and then you go round and round. Give me five! That's - there you go. We've been here all morning doing the turkey dance with a few people here in Houston. Take a look. (BEGIN VIDEO CLIP)

utterances.speaker: FLORES
utterances.sentences: Ready?

utterances.speaker: UNIDENTIFIED FEMALE
utterances.sentences: And they - and they - and they all say gobble, gobble.

utterances.speaker: FLORES
utterances.sentences: Oh, gobble, gobble. OK. So, we'll do, I'm a turkey, I'm a turkey, and then gobble, gobble, OK? OK.Three, two, and one.

utterances.speaker: FLORES AND UNIDENTIFIED FEMALE
utterances.sentences: I'm a turkey. I'm a turkey. Gobble, gobble, gobble, gobble.

utterances.speaker: CROWD
utterances.sentences: Yay!

utterances.speaker: FLORES
utterances.sentences: Three, two and one.Flap your wings, and show your feathers. (INAUDIBLE).

utterances.speaker: FLORES
utterances.sentences: Yay! High five! That's so funny. High five.(END VIDEO CLIP)

utterances.speaker: FLORES
utterances.sentences: And, Erica and John, do you know why turkeys dance in Texas? Well, our survivability rate is really high because, let's be honest, in Texas, a lot of people are not having turkey. They're going to be having barbecue. So, our survivability is really high.And, John, I have a question for you. Are you wearing a cowboy hat, my friend?

utterances.speaker: BERMAN
utterances.sentences: I am. I am wearing my CNN Fourth of July in America cowboy hat.

utterances.speaker: FLORES
utterances.sentences: Are you trying to steal my thunder?

utterances.speaker: BERMAN
utterances.sentences: I - can I tell you something, Rosa?

utterances.speaker: FLORES
utterances.sentences: Are you trying to steal my thunder here from Texas?

utterances.speaker: BERMAN
utterances.sentences: There's no way I could steal your thunder.

utterances.speaker: HILL
utterances.sentences: Uh-uh.

utterances.speaker: BERMAN
utterances.sentences: After what you just did, it's over. It's like game over. Like, drop the mic.

utterances.speaker: HILL
utterances.sentences: Rosa wins.

utterances.speaker: BERMAN
utterances.sentences: Rosa wins completely.

utterances.speaker: HILL
utterances.sentences: We adore you. We will see more of you and your turkey dancing just ahead.Meantime, back here in New York, deep in the parade trenches is where we find Omar Jimenez. Good luck following that.

utterances.speaker: BERMAN
utterances.sentences: He's dancing on the inside.

utterances.speaker: OMAR JIMENEZ, CNN CORRESPONDENT
utterances.sentences: Yes. Look, I couldn't see it, but I could hear a lot going on. I can do a lot of things. I cant' do whatever was just happening a few minutes ago.I'm just here watching some of the parades and the floats going by. We've been watching a lot of the balloons. But what I've also been watching, it's been great people watching, too. I mean people have been hunkered down throughout all of this. They're still cheering, still exciting. I think we thought the rain was going to let up a little bit, but it's only just gotten more and more tough as we've been here. Everybody's waving. What's up, guys? What's up? We've been chatting with a few of them. And as these floats have come by, it feels like it's waves of excitement even through the rain. Let's talk with some of them here. Hey, what's going on? How are you guys feeling right now? You feeling good?

utterances.speaker: UNIDENTIFIED MALE
utterances.sentences: Yes.

utterances.speaker: JIMENEZ
utterances.sentences: Yes. Where are you guys from?

utterances.speaker: UNIDENTIFIED FEMALE
utterances.sentences: Rhode Island.

utterances.speaker: JIMENEZ
utterances.sentences: Rhode Island. Did you think it was going to be as rainy and wet as it is now?

utterances.speaker: UNIDENTIFIED FEMALE
utterances.sentences: I thought it was going to be worse. This is completely doable. We're having a great time.

utterances.speaker: JIMENEZ
utterances.sentences: See, that's the positivity we're here for. They thought it was going to be worse. It's even better than they imagined.Have you come to this before?

utterances.speaker: UNIDENTIFIED FEMALE
utterances.sentences: Yes, we were here last year.

utterances.speaker: JIMENEZ
utterances.sentences: What's your favorite part about being here at the parade?

utterances.speaker: UNIDENTIFIED FEMALE
utterances.sentences: Oh, the chanting, the excitement, the thankfulness. We love it.

utterances.speaker: JIMENEZ
utterances.sentences: Thankfulness. These are your kids here?

utterances.speaker: UNIDENTIFIED FEMALE
utterances.sentences: Yes.

utterances.speaker: JIMENEZ
utterances.sentences: All right. Who - how are you feeling right now? Are you dry? Are you wet? Where are you?

utterances.speaker: UNIDENTIFIED FEMALE
utterances.sentences: Wet.

utterances.speaker: JIMENEZ
utterances.sentences: What's your favorite parade float that you're looking for today?

utterances.speaker: UNIDENTIFIED FEMALE
utterances.sentences: Minnie.

utterances.speaker: UNIDENTIFIED FEMALE
utterances.sentences: Minnie.

utterances.speaker: JIMENEZ
utterances.sentences: Oh, OK. All right. We've got a - all right, what about you?

utterances.speaker: UNIDENTIFIED MALE
utterances.sentences: Uh -

utterances.speaker: UNIDENTIFIED MALE
utterances.sentences: Macy's (ph).

utterances.speaker: HILL
utterances.sentences: A little bit. Just a little bit.

utterances.speaker: BERMAN
utterances.sentences: But I - I love that - you're from Connecticut. I love the Rhode Island people. Like, this isn't rain.

utterances.speaker: HILL
utterances.sentences: Yes. It's not bad at all.

utterances.speaker: BERMAN
utterances.sentences: It's not bad weather. We get bad weather up there.

utterances.speaker: HILL
utterances.sentences: Hardy New Englanders. That's what I like.

utterances.speaker: BERMAN
utterances.sentences: Yes, exactly.

utterances.speaker: BERMAN
utterances.sentences: All right, this is CNN "Thanksgiving in America." You just heard "The Star-Spangled Banner" from Houston. The parade there about to kick off. We would have been standing to rise for the national anthem, but we're in such tight quarters here -

utterances.speaker: HILL
utterances.sentences: We can't move.

utterances.speaker: BERMAN
utterances.sentences: We can't move at all, which is why we didn't dance with Rosa Flores moments ago when she was doing the turkey dance.

utterances.speaker: HILL
utterances.sentences: We were dancing inside. Dancing in spirit.

utterances.speaker: BERMAN
utterances.sentences: We were dancing inside.

utterances.speaker: HILL
utterances.sentences: Yes.

utterances.speaker: BERMAN
utterances.sentences: So, while you're all excited to eat a big meal today, maybe put up your Christmas tree. Others - others may not be as fortunate. That's where A Sense of Home is helping out. The organization helps create first ever homes for youths aging out of foster care with a little help from property brothers Drew Scott.Stephanie Elam shares this surprise of a lifetime for one young mother. (BEGIN VIDEOTAPE) STEPHANIE ELAM, CNN CORRESPONDENT (voice over): In just about 90 minutes, this empty apartment will be full of furniture and love. For 23-year-old Anahi Rodriguez -

utterances.speaker: ANAHI RODRIGUEZ, A SENSE OF HOME RECIPIENT
utterances.sentences: I've been house to house ever since I was like ten.ELAM (voice over): This also marks a turning point for her and her three-year-old daughter.

utterances.speaker: RODRIGUEZ
utterances.sentences: And thank you to everybody. And thank you for doing this.ELAM (voice over): Anahi entered foster care after her mother and then her aunt were deported. For the college student and soccer player, this is the first place she's had on her own.

utterances.speaker: GEORGIE SMITH, FOUNDER AND CEO, A SENSE OF HOME
utterances.sentences: The home creation is a vehicle for connecting someone who has been not connected to love or community, to become connected to love and community.ELAM (voice over): Georgie Smith launched nonprofit A Sense of Home nine years ago.

utterances.speaker: SMITH
utterances.sentences: We should put the bed here.ELAM (voice over): Transforming places to live into warm, inviting homes for people who have aged out of foster care.

utterances.speaker: SMITH
utterances.sentences: They were never adopted and they never had a home of their own. This is completely life-changing.ELAM (voice over): In 2016, she was named a top ten CNN Hero for her work.

utterances.speaker: SMITH
utterances.sentences: In the U.S. there is around 500,000 every year in the system. And then there's between 10 percent to 20 percent aging out. The actual homeless population, 50 percent, spent time in foster care. So, there is a completely direct link.ELAM (voice over): All of the furniture, rugs, even the artwork is donated to A Sense of Home from individuals and brand partners.

utterances.speaker: SMITH
utterances.sentences: Home defines everything. It defines our health, our mental health, our well-being, our happiness, our connection to attachment and belonging. It all begins in home. Everything begins in homes.ELAM (voice over): These strangers are working together, united in their goal to make Anahi's apartment a home. DREW SCOTT, "PROPERTY BROTHERS": And I had to get over here to help out. How are you?

utterances.speaker: ELAM
utterances.sentences: That's allowed.ELAM (voice over): With the help of a "Property Brother," Drew Scott.

utterances.speaker: SCOTT
utterances.sentences: Just hold this here.

utterances.speaker: ELAM
utterances.sentences: How do you decide what goes where? How do you decide?

utterances.speaker: SCOTT
utterances.sentences: Just old this here.

utterances.speaker: ELAM
utterances.sentences: Oh, just keep -

utterances.speaker: SCOTT
utterances.sentences: Well, I just like to - I like to look at everything. Just hold this here. Can I - no, OK.I would call this lazy design because A Sense of Home has such a great team. Their design team is amazing. They do all the heavy lifting. I think this big one is going to be perfect above the sofa. I wanted to make sure it feels like christmas, so I brought one of our Christmas trees and some ornaments and we just kind of get that set up too once we figure out our art and the rest of the pieces. So, it's beginning to look a lot like Christmas. ELAM (voice over): While Anahi waits outside, along with Oso (ph), the dog she rescued from the street, the work continues inside.

utterances.speaker: NAHANI LOMELI, CASE MANAGER, HOPE STREET FAMILY CENTER
utterances.sentences: This is a moment a moment for her to really like sit there and think about how blessed she really is.

utterances.speaker: ELAM
utterances.sentences: OK, so how do you feel?

utterances.speaker: RODRIGUEZ
utterances.sentences: Nervous.

utterances.speaker: ELAM
utterances.sentences: You're nervous?

utterances.speaker: RODRIGUEZ
utterances.sentences: Yes.

utterances.speaker: SCOTT
utterances.sentences: Anahi looks nervous. She looks a bit nervous.Are you nervous, Anahi? Tunnel of love. Welcome home.

utterances.speaker: RODRIGUEZ
utterances.sentences: Oh, my. It look so nice.

utterances.speaker: SCOTT
utterances.sentences: Does it feel like home?And then the bedrooms.

utterances.speaker: RODRIGUEZ
utterances.sentences: Oh. Finally, a bed. UNIDENTIFIED FEMALE

utterances.speaker: SCOTT
utterances.sentences: I can't wait to see your daughter come in here. Let's go (INAUDIBLE).You've been on a big journey, and it really means a lot to be a part of helping your family feel at home. So, I hope you're happy.

utterances.speaker: RODRIGUEZ
utterances.sentences: Oh, very.

utterances.speaker: SCOTT
utterances.sentences: She's worked hard. She now has a sense of community. With an organization like A Sense of Home, she's set up for success.I'm also excited for her daughter. She's three years old. I have - my son's two and a half. I tear up when I think about it.

utterances.speaker: RODRIGUEZ
utterances.sentences: So, I'm very grateful for everybody. And I haven't felt this in a really long time. And I want to thank you guys.ELAM (voice over): For Anahi, her new place is like a dream compared to what it felt like before.

utterances.speaker: LOMELI
utterances.sentences: She's an amazing mom. She really is.ELAM (voice over): While her most pressing goal is to be there for her daughter, who is autistic and nonverbal -

utterances.speaker: RODRIGUEZ
utterances.sentences: I want to see her interact. I want to see her talk to me.ELAM (voice over): Anahi says she now has the foundation to pursue the future she sees for herself, playing soccer for a four-year institution and hopefully going pro.

utterances.speaker: RODRIGUEZ
utterances.sentences: I feel important. I feel special. Something that I really don't feel at all. So, I will forever be grateful to A Sense of Home and to everybody that came here today to support me. So, I'm very excited for the holidays now.ELAM (voice over): Stephanie Elam, CNN, Los Angeles. (END VIDEOTAPE)

utterances.speaker: HILL
utterances.sentences: That's a great story and a great organization.

utterances.speaker: BERMAN
utterances.sentences: That was just amazing to see.

utterances.speaker: HILL
utterances.sentences: Yes. BERMANAnd a reminder, you can watch Drew and his brother Jonathan on "Property Brothers" anytime streaming on Max. All right, chef and restaurateur Erin French of The Lost Kitchen is back with us again this Thanksgiving morning. Earlier, she taught us how to make her delicious crispy onion and potato holiday pie. But now, for the moment of truth. Oh, I see you're there with your husband too. How did it turn out? ERIN FRENCH, CHEF, OWNER OF THE LOST KITCHEN, AND HOST OF "GETTING LOST WITH ERIN FRENCH": I know. He showed up. You can tell the scents are good because the husband starts showing up. So, here we go.

utterances.speaker: MICHAEL DUTTON, HUSBAND OF ERIN FRENCH
utterances.sentences: It's true. I'm not going to lie.

utterances.speaker: FRENCH
utterances.sentences: All right, so there it is, in all its glory. You got all that flavor. The potato. There's a little bit of butter in there. The grapes. The crispy shallots. So, I put the crispy shallots on like five minutes before I took it out of the oven. And they just got nice and toastier.And then the last thing is just to sprinkle a bit of fresh thyme over the top because it tastes good and it looks really pretty. And then you just dig in and you enjoy. And, like I said, you could make this tomorrow if you have leftovers. You can use cranberry sauce. You can throw turkey in there. You serve it with a big salad. And it never tastes boring. So, we'll give it to our taste tester here who will let us know the truth about this. But, I love this pie. It's got like a little bit of everything and it tastes just enough different, but it's comforting at the same time. Yes, that's going to be a good one.

utterances.speaker: HILL
utterances.sentences: It looks incredible.

utterances.speaker: FRENCH
utterances.sentences: That one's for you, Michael.

utterances.speaker: HILL
utterances.sentences: Next year I think we should maybe be at Erin's for Thanksgiving, John.

utterances.speaker: DUTTON
utterances.sentences: Yes, you guys should come up for -

utterances.speaker: BERMAN
utterances.sentences: What happens to the grapes? I - when you were putting the grapes in -

utterances.speaker: FRENCH
utterances.sentences: Don't come to my house. I'm never - I never throw a Thanksgiving - Yes, the grapes. I just gave him them a quick saute, because you want them to still, like, pop. You don't want it to be like jammy. You want to have a little bit of freshness with that because we've been eating a lot of pureed stuff.So, I don't know. What do you think? What do you think?

utterances.speaker: DUTTON
utterances.sentences: Mmm.

utterances.speaker: FRENCH
utterances.sentences: It's good, right?

utterances.speaker: DUTTON
utterances.sentences: So the grapes, they hold their shape. They hold their firmness. They hold their sweetness.

utterances.speaker: FRENCH
utterances.sentences: Sweet.

utterances.speaker: DUTTON
utterances.sentences: But they're warm.

utterances.speaker: FRENCH
utterances.sentences: And you get the crunchy too. The crunchy with all the shallots on top too. Like, creamy, sweet, crunchy, savory. It's like everything you want to eat on Thanksgiving or any day.

utterances.speaker: DUTTON
utterances.sentences: Amazing.

utterances.speaker: HILL
utterances.sentences: It's a perfect combination.

utterances.speaker: DUTTON
utterances.sentences: We're taking this down to our Friendsgiving.

utterances.speaker: HILL
utterances.sentences: There's some big things happening in The Lost Kitchen starting Friday, I think, right, Erin.

utterances.speaker: FRENCH
utterances.sentences: Yes, our market opens tomorrow. So here at the mill we open the whole place up, which is kind of a big deal because it's pretty hard to get into the restaurant. But it's fun to open the whole mill. Our online shop is open. So we're at findthelostkitchen.com. We have so many beautiful gifts. If you know someone who loves the kitchen, buy them a gift there because all of your friends should be foodies. So, it's the place to go this season. So, we're really excited. Our team's jazzed and there will be lots of good food around here too.

utterances.speaker: DUTTON
utterances.sentences: Yes.

utterances.speaker: HILL
utterances.sentences: That's great.

utterances.speaker: FRENCH
utterances.sentences: That's definitely more (INAUDIBLE).

utterances.speaker: BERMAN
utterances.sentences: So good. Our thanks to you.

utterances.speaker: DUTTON
utterances.sentences: It's so good.

utterances.speaker: BERMAN
utterances.sentences: All right, Erin French, thank you so much to you.

utterances.speaker: FRENCH
utterances.sentences: Thanks, guys. Happy Thanksgiving.

utterances.speaker: BERMAN
utterances.sentences: Thanks to Michael for testing things out. Happy Thanksgiving to you all. Have fun where you're going. They're going to love that dish you just made for all of us.

utterances.speaker: DUTTON
utterances.sentences: Thank you, guys. Thank you, guys. Come see us (INAUDIBLE).

utterances.speaker: BERMAN
utterances.sentences: All right, for more info on Erin's holiday market, visit findthelostkitchen.com.

utterances.speaker: HILL
utterances.sentences: So, just ahead, we have a lot more coming your way. A little train there coming at you from Philadelphia. The train going (INAUDIBLE) the All-American Express Train Float pulling three more cars behind it.

utterances.speaker: BERMAN
utterances.sentences: And a whole lot of Amex points.

utterances.speaker: HILL
utterances.sentences: A whole lot of Amex points. Boy, are you cashing those in for quite a ride on this Thanksgiving morning.

utterances.speaker: BERMAN
utterances.sentences: That's right. That's right.
